tweets.html:
My God, the cold open of Breaking Bad's 3rd Season makes me fall in love with the entire medium of television.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) June 1, 2013

Before Midnight: There really are few things in modern cinema as thrilling & joyous as watching Ethan Hawke/Julie Delpy talk to each other.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) June 1, 2013

THE MAN WHO THOUGHT HIS DOG WAS TALKING TO HIM ABOUT BAKED BEANS by Oliver Sacks

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) June 1, 2013

Oh man. I JUST started playing the 1st ep of #SYTYCD and the OPENING MONTAGE has a bitch in tears. Gonna have to put it off. #NotToday

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) June 2, 2013

Twitter is the worst television enabler.

— Jordan Davis (@JordanDavisPoet) June 2, 2013

The only acceptable political stance is being a Browncoat, why yes I am watching Serenity

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) June 2, 2013

Sports is to Twitter what Baby Pictures are to Facebook.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) June 2, 2013

It physically hurts me that I can't sleep with Jesse Pinkman.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) June 2, 2013

The key to appreciating any William Fichtner performance is imagining he's taking a deep hit of dirty socks before the camera is on him.

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) June 2, 2013

You know how people dump bad news on Fridays, hoping it'll be forgotten over the weekend?

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) June 2, 2013

Basically, I think ABC Family is trying that, but waiting for a major terror attack, re: #Bunheads.

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) June 2, 2013

Can #Community maintain its magic now that it's lost showrunners Guarascio and Port?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 1, 2013

But how will The Mindy Project survive without Chris McKenna?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) June 1, 2013

Wait a minute, this isn't Dan Harmon! It's Shonda Rhimes in a Dan Harmon suit! We just got Shonda'd!

— Andy Bobrow (@abobrow) June 1, 2013

But which Dan Harmon will we get? Sweet Season 1 Dan? Fun Season 2 Dan? Or Crazy Season 3 Dan?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 1, 2013

Dear @danharmon, my parents think Mark Harmon is coming to COMMUNITY season 5. You have 3 eps to impress them OR dress @joelmchale as him.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) June 1, 2013

The Dan Harmon story circle, applied to Dan Harmon's story... circle... pic.twitter.com/TkTTCW0GP4

— Julieta Colás (@jujujulieta) June 1, 2013

Community filters still holding strong. Godspeed, TweetDeck.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 1, 2013

@danharmon Your staff should be Frank Darabont, Glen Mazzara and Theresa Rebeck.

— Bryan Seabury (@BryanSeabury) June 1, 2013

My DVD collection is going to look really weird when I own Community, season 1-3, 5.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 1, 2013

This big Doctor Who announcement (actor leaves role; show to continue without him) has been brought to you by the year 1966.

— Simon Kinnear (@kinnemaniac) June 1, 2013

Possible 12th Doctors: Ben Schwartz, Jesse Eisenberg, Andy Milonakis, Dave from Happy Endings #doctorwho

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) June 1, 2013

The real Inspector Spacetime quits the same day Dan Harmon comes back to Community. COINCIDENCE? Yes because life is a chaotic cycle of shit

— Andy Khouri (@andykhouri) June 1, 2013

Today's been a real emotional roller coaster for fans of Inspector Spacetime. :/

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) June 1, 2013

Matt Smith is my Bennedict Cumberpatch.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) June 1, 2013

The audition process for Doctor 12 involves solving problems with bullshit while being drowned out by incidental music

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) June 1, 2013

I'd watch Aaron Paul as #DoctorWho. I'd watch it so much.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) June 1, 2013

Meanwhile, we've been without a Doctor Wherefore for years and no one seems to care.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) June 1, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Actually, I think I'd like to see Dominic West as the new Doctor. Maybe he can say "the fuck did I do?" in his normal voice for once?

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) June 1, 2013

Seriously, though, Chiwetel Ejiofor for the next Doctor. Make it happen, world.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) June 1, 2013

Never seen Doctor Who, can't weigh in on who should take the role. But I do need Romola Garai back on my TV as soon as humanly possible. So.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) June 1, 2013

The 8th series of #DoctorWho will be a complicated, season-long puzzle about who is playing The Doctor. I'm onto you, Moffat.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 1, 2013

They give us Dan Harmon but take away Matt Smith. It's like the LOST island when the baby was born but Boone died.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) June 1, 2013

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
I can't wait to see stupid, racist, sexist comments on suggestions that The Doctor be played by anything but a white male!

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) June 1, 2013

If you ever wondered what the internet equivalent of a mental breakdown looks like, here's the Doctor Who Tumblr tag: http://t.co/BSfkNDin9m

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) June 1, 2013

For a moment, imagine Tatiana Maslany as the 12th Doctor. Now let the glory of that moment wash over you. You've just been saved!

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) June 2, 2013

Seen on Tumblr: "Oh Jesus, this is worse than the Reichenbach Fall." #doctorwho

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) June 2, 2013

There's gonna be a new Dr Who. Does that mean they finally got rid of the guy with the bug eyes, Afro and huge scarf?

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) June 2, 2013

According to twitter consensus, the next Doctor should be a ginger black woman. Good luck with that, Moffat. #DoctorWho

— Kendra Lynne (@kendralynneee) June 2, 2013

Curse you, Matt Smith. I haven't been this unfairly upstaged in the news since my Fall 2001 Atkins Announcement.

— Dan Harmon (@danharmon) June 2, 2013

Guys: this isn't a vote. The only way that New #doctorwho time is like a national election is you just know it'll be another white guy.

— Laurie Penny (@PennyRed) June 2, 2013

Ten years ago we had Christopher Eccleston, David Tennant & Matt Smith. Now we have 50000008 tweets praying for Idris Elba in an odd jacket.

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) June 2, 2013

Dinklage. 12th Doctor. Mic drop.

— Joel Watson (@hijinksensue) June 2, 2013

Sean Bean is going to be the 12th Doctor. Unfortunately, he'll regenerate after only one episode. #DoctorWho

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 2, 2013

List of things I'm not allowed to own: golf club, nail gun, hot glue gun, actual gun. Thanks, #OrphanBlack.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 1, 2013

clone down! clone down! #OrphanBlack Holy sheeeeeett. #LondonCalling

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) June 2, 2013

Uuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuum #OrphanBlack

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) June 2, 2013

There is definitely a lot of Maslany happening right now. She would be disturbed. It's so beautiful.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) June 2, 2013

So Orphan Black is Not. Fucking. Around.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) June 2, 2013

Reveal of what was hidden in the DNA on Orphan Black absolutely gutted me. Well played, show. See you in 2014.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) June 2, 2013

Ever have words pop up in your feed for weeks and you don't know what they mean until you realize you should've been watching ORPHAN BLACK?

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) June 2, 2013

#LateNightTwitter right now is like Nighthawks, but with Tatiana Maslany's face super-imposed over all the patrons.

— Scaremy Jingleghost (@JeremyMonjo) June 2, 2013

When AD S4 puts Arnett and Bateman on-screen at the same time, it's as good as old AD. They're just fantastic.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) June 2, 2013

Still kinda surprised people entertained by Community's Beetlejuice gag aren't digging a whole season of Beetlejuice gags. #AD

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) June 2, 2013
